senses.de: The ability to make another person or thing change by actions or words
senses.ex: She has a lot of influence over the way her children behave.

Tips.title: Subtle Persuasion
Tips.description: Think of 'influence' as a soft power, guiding rather than commanding.
Tips.example: Her suggestions subtly influence our team's choices.

Tips.title: Not Always Visible
Tips.description: 'Influence' often works behind the scenes, not immediately obvious.
Tips.example: His influence is often felt, though he rarely speaks up.

Tips.title: Emotional Impact
Tips.description: The word can carry an emotional weight, indicating respect and admiration.
Tips.example: The poet's work continues to influence young writers today.

senses.de: To change how someone or something behaves, thinks, or develops
senses.ex: The teacher's inspiration influenced my decision to study science.

Tips.title: Wide Effect
Tips.description: Used as a verb, 'influence' can refer to changes in a broad range of areas.
Tips.example: A new law can influence many aspects of daily life.

Tips.title: Impersonal Force
Tips.description: Sometimes used to suggest an almost mysterious guiding force.
Tips.example: Market trends are influenced by many unpredictable factors.

senses.de: A person or thing that can change other's behavior or thoughts
senses.ex: He is a bad influence on my daughter.

Tips.title: Positive or Negative
Tips.description: Remember 'influence' can be beneficial or harmful, depending on context.
Tips.example: Peer pressure can be a negative influence on teenagers.

Tips.title: Personal Relationships
Tips.description: Often used to describe the effect someone has on another's character or decisions.
Tips.example: A mentor's influence can last a lifetime.

senses.de: The power to impact other people or things, especially in a secretive or indirect way
senses.ex: His influence in the political world is not visible, but it is very strong.

Tips.title: Unseen Power
Tips.description: Highlights the clandestine aspect of influence in politics or business.
Tips.example: Lobbyists hold considerable influence over some lawmakers.

Tips.title: Strategic Hold
Tips.description: Influence here is about strategic positioning and the power it confers.
Tips.example: Major companies exert influence to shape industry regulations.

Authority.wordDefinition:
Authority refers to the power or right to make decisions and enforce laws or rules.

It is typically given to individuals or organizations by laws, regulations or formal position in a hierarchy. For example, a teacher has the authority to set rules and enforce them in the classroom.

Influence refers to the ability to affect or persuade someone's beliefs or actions without necessarily having formal power or authority.

Both authority and influence can be used to achieve a desired outcome, but authority is more about the use of power and control, while influence is more about persuasion and motivation.

Control.wordDefinition:
Control usually means having power over someone or something, and being able to direct or regulate their actions or behavior.

For example, a teacher may have control over their students in a classroom because they are responsible for their learning and behavior.

The word influence means having the ability to affect or impact someone or something without necessarily having direct control.

For instance, a friend may have a positive influence on you, encouraging you to make good choices, but they likely don't have direct control over your decisions.

Each word is applicable in different situations. Control is typically used when describing a situation where someone has explicit power over others to direct or regulate their behavior, while influence describes a more subtle form of impact or effect on someone or something.

Dominance.wordDefinition:
Dominance refers to the exercise of power or control over others whereas influence refers to the ability to affect or persuade others without necessarily having power or control over them.

Dominance is often associated with situations where one person or group has authority over another and can use their position to make decisions or enforce particular behaviors.

Both dominance and influence can be applied in a variety of contexts, from personal relationships to business settings.

However, dominance tends to be more coercive and unilateral while influence is more collaborative and two-way.

Effect.wordDefinition:
Effect refers to the result or consequence of something that has happened or been done. It's used to describe a specific outcome that has occurred due to a particular action or event.

For example, the effect of studying hard is getting good grades.

To sum it up, effect describes a specific outcome, while influence describes the impact something or someone has on another.

Impact.wordDefinition:
Impact refers to the forceful result of a certain action or event.

It describes the immediate and direct effect of something. For example, if a car hits a wall, it will have an impact on the wall and leave a dent.

Impact refers to the immediate effect of something while influence refers to the long-term effect that can shape and mold someone's attitudes or behavior.

Leverage.wordDefinition:
Leverage means using a strategic advantage to achieve a desired outcome or goal. It is applicable in situations where you want to use something to your advantage to get what you want.

For example, a business might leverage their strong financial position to negotiate better deals with suppliers.

So, essentially, influence is about persuasion, while leverage is about using strategic advantage.

Persuasion.wordDefinition:
Persuasion refers to the act of convincing or swaying someone to see things the way you see them, or take a particular action.

Influence is something that comes naturally or over time, while persuasion is a more deliberate or intentional effort to change someone's mind or behavior.

Power.wordDefinition:
Power is the ability to control or command someone or something.

Power is often backed by authority, resources or force.

Both influence and power are applicable in different situations.

Power is more applicable in organizational or institutional contexts where decisions need to be made or enforced.

Influence is the ability to persuade, while power is the ability to control.

Sway.wordDefinition:
Influence and sway are similar words that mean to have an effect on something or someone.

However, the difference lies in the degree and type of effect. Influence implies having a positive impact and the ability to shape opinions or decisions, whereas sway suggests a more powerful or persuasive effect that can push someone to act or think a certain way, even if it is not in their best interest.

For example, a teacher may have an influence on their students by inspiring them to learn and achieve their goals. A public speaker may try to sway their audience by using emotional appeals or manipulating facts to convince them of a certain viewpoint, even if it is not based on truth or reason.

Influence is more subtle and constructive, while sway is more forceful and manipulative.

quotes.Text: When you touch the life of a man of this generation, that influence is felt through generations yet to come.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.Text: I really like hip-hop and rap; that's my main influence. I really wanna be more of a hip-hop artist.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Billie Eilish

quotes.Text: I think your values are always influenced by your family and your community.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Dolly Parton

quotes.Text: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Mark Twain

quotes.Text: Woman's influence is powerful, especially when she wants something.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Josh Billings

quotes.Text: The secret of my influence has always been that it remained secret.
quotes.Title: Spanish Artist
quotes.Name: Salvador Dali

quotes.Text: Blessed is the influence of one true, loving human soul on another.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: George Eliot

quotes.Text: I have been influenced in my thinking by both west and east.
quotes.Title: South African Statesman
quotes.Name: Nelson Mandela

quotes.Text: The future influences the present just as much as the past.
quotes.Title: German Philosopher
quotes.Name: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.Text: My style influences my music and everything around me.
quotes.Title: Puerto Rican Singer
quotes.Name: Bad Bunny
